Suppose $P$ is a set of $n$ red and $n$ (or $n-1$) blue points, and suppose there is a line $L$ with $r$ red and $b$ blue points. Let $r'= n-r$ and $b'= n-b$ (or $b'= n-1-b$). Then the number of bichromatic lines is at least $$ \min_{i\in [b']} \left\{ i + (r-1)\max \left\{ \ceil{\frac{b'}{i}} , i \right\} \right\} + \min_{i\in [r']} \left\{ i + (b-1)\max \left\{ \ceil{\frac{r'}{i}} , i \right\} \right\} \enspace .$$ Moreover, if $r,b\geq 1$ we may add one more to this total.
Let $S$ be a set of cardinality $n$ and $\{ S_1, \ldots, S_k \}$ a collection of subsets of $S$ such that each pair of elements in $S$ is contained in exactly one $S_i$. Then either $S=S_i$ for some $i$, or $k\geq n$.
Every non-collinear set of red and blue points in the plane determines a monochromatic line.
Let $P$ be a set of $n$ red, and $n$ or $n-1$ blue points in the plane. If neither colour class is collinear, then $P$ determines at least $|P|-3$ bichromatic lines.
Let $P$ be a set of $n$ red, and $n$ or $n-1$ blue points in the plane. If $P$ is not collinear or a near-pencil,  then $P$ determines at least $|P|-1$ bichromatic lines.
Let $P$ be a non-collinear set of points. Then $$ t_2 \geq 3+ \sum_{i\geq 3}(i-3)t_i \enspace .$$
Let $P$ be a set of points with at most $|P|-3$ collinear. Then $$ t_2 +\frac{3}{4}t_3 \geq n + \sum_{i\geq5}(2i-9)t_i \enspace . $$
Let $\epsilon >0$. \begin{enumerate}[{\rm (a)}] \item For any $p\in [1,\vc]$ we have $$ \Big(\int_X\Big[\Big(1+\f{d(x,y)}{s}\Big)^{-n-\epsilon}\Big]^p\dy\Big)^{1/p}\lesi V(x,s)^{1/p}, $$ for all $x\in X$ and $s>0$.  \item For any $f\in L^1_{\rm loc}(X)$ we have $$ \int_X\f{1}{V(x\wedge y,s)}\Big(1+\f{d(x,y)}{s}\Big)^{-n-\epsilon}|f(y)|\dy\lesi \mathcal{M}f(x), $$ for all $x\in X$ and $s>0$ where $V(x\wedge y,s) =\min\{V(x,s), V(y,s)\}$. \end{enumerate}
There exists a collection of open sets $\{Q_\tau^k\subset X: k\in \mathbb{Z}, \tau\in I_k\}$, where $I_k$ denotes certain (possibly finite) index set depending on $k$, and constants $\rho\in (0,1), a_0\in (0,1]$ and $\kappa_0\in (0,\vc)$ such that \begin{enumerate}[(i)] \item $\mu(X\backslash \cup_\tau Q_\tau^k)=0$ for all $k\in \mathbb{Z}$; \item if $i\geq k$, then either $Q_\tau^i \subset Q_\beta^k$ or $Q_\tau^i \cap Q_\beta^k=\emptyset$; \item for $(k,\tau)$ and each $i<k$, there exists a unique $\tau'$ such $Q_\tau^k\subset Q_{\tau'}^i$; \item the diameter ${\rm diam}\,(Q_\tau^k)\leq \kappa_0 \rho^k$; \item each $Q_\tau^k$ contains certain ball $B(x_{Q_\tau^k}, a_0\rho^k)$. \end{enumerate}
Let $\varphi\in \SR$ be an even function with {\rm supp}\,$\varphi\subset (-1, 1)$ and $\int \varphi =2\pi$. Denote by $\Phi$ the Fourier transform of $\varphi$. Then for every $k \in \mathbb{N}$, the kernel $K_{(t^2L)^k\Phi(t\sqrt{L})}$ of $(t^2L)^k\Phi(t\sqrt{L})$ satisfies \begin{equation} \displaystyle {\rm supp}\,K_{(t^2L)^k\Phi(t\sqrt{L})}\subset \{(x,y)\in X\times X: d(x,y)\leq t\}, \end{equation} and \begin{equation} |K_{(t^2L)^k\Phi(t\sqrt{L})}(x,y)|\leq \f{C}{V(x,t)}. \end{equation}
\begin{enumerate}[{\rm (a)}] \item Let $\varphi\in \mathscr{S}(\mathbb{R})$ be an even function. Then for any $N>0$ there exists $C$ such that \begin{equation}  |K_{\varphi(t\sqrt{L})}(x,y)|\leq \f{C}{V(x\vee y,t)}\Big(1+\f{d(x,y)}{t}\Big)^{-N}, \end{equation} for all $t>0$ and $x,y\in X$. \item Let $\varphi_1, \varphi_2\in \mathscr{S}(\mathbb{R})$ be even functions. Then for any $N>0$ there exists $C$ such that \begin{equation}  |K_{\varphi_1(t\sqrt{L})\varphi_2(s\sqrt{L})}(x,y)|\leq C\f{1}{V(x\vee y,t)}\Big(1+\f{d(x,y)}{t}\Big)^{-N}, \end{equation} for all $t\leq s<2t$ and $x,y\in X$. \item Let $\varphi_1, \varphi_2\in \mathscr{S}(\mathbb{R})$ be even functions with $\varphi^{(\nu)}_2(0)=0$ for $\nu=0,1,\ldots,2\ell$ for some $\ell\in\mathbb{Z}^+$. Then for any $N>0$ there exists $C$ such that \begin{equation}  |K_{\varphi_1(t\sqrt{L})\varphi_2(s\sqrt{L})}(x,y)|\leq C\Big(\f{s}{t}\Big)^{2\ell} \f{1}{V(x\vee y,t)}\Big(1+\f{d(x,y)}{t}\Big)^{-N}, \end{equation} for all $t\geq s>0$ and $x,y\in X$. \end{enumerate}
Assume that $L$ satisfies (\ref{eq1-mainthmsm}). Then for any $x,y\in X$, \begin{equation}  |K_{F(\sL)}(x, y)|\leq \f{C}{\sqrt{V(x,R^{-1})V(y,R^{-1})}}\|\delta_R F\|_{\tilde q} \end{equation} for all bounded Borel function $F$ with ${\rm supp}\, \subset [0,R]$.
Let $R,s>0$. Then for any $\epsilon>0$ there exists a constant $C=C(s,\epsilon)$ such that \begin{equation} |K_{F(\sL)}(x,y)| \leq C\f{(1+Rd(x,y))^{-s}}{\sqrt{V(x,R^{-1})V(y,R^{-1})}}\|\delta_RF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_{s+\epsilon}} \end{equation} for any bounded Borel function $F$ supported in $[R/4, R]$ and for all $x,y\in X$.
Let $R,s>0$. Then for any $\epsilon>0$ there exists a constant $C=C(s,\epsilon)$ such that \begin{equation} \Big[\int_X|K_{F(\sL)}(x,y)|^2(1+Rd(x,y))^{2s} \dy\Big]^{1/2} \leq \f{C}{V(x,R^{-1})^{\f{1}{2}}}\|\delta_RF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_{s+\epsilon}} \end{equation} for any bounded Borel function $F$ supported in $[R/4, R]$ and for all $x,y\in X$.
Let $\psi$ be a partition of unity and let $a_Q$ be an $(L, M, p)$ atom with some $Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu$. Then for any $t>0$ and $N>0$ we have: \begin{equation} |\psi(t\sL)F(\sL) a_Q(x)|\lesi \Big(\f{t}{2^{-\nu}}\wedge \f{2^{-\nu}}{t}\Big)^{2M-n}V(Q)^{-1/p} \Big(1+\f{d(x,x_Q)}{2^{-\nu}\vee t}\Big)^{-s'+\f{\tilde n}{2}} \end{equation} for any $s>s'>\f{n}{1\wedge p\wedge q}+\f{\tilde{n}}{2}$.
Let $N>n$ and $\eta, \nu \in \mathbb{Z}$, $\nu\geq \eta$. Assume that $\{f_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}$ is a sequence of functions satisfying $$ |f_Q(x)|\lesi \Big(1+\f{d(x,x_Q)}{2^{-\eta}}\Big)^{-N}. $$ Then for $\f{n}{N}<r\leq 1$ and a sequence of numbers $\{s_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}$, we have $$ \sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}|s_Q|\,|f_Q(x)|\lesi 2^{n(\nu-\eta)/r}\mathcal{M}_{r}\Big(\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}|s_Q|\chi_Q\Big)(x). $$
Assume that the condition \eqref{eq1-mainthmsm-multi} holds true. Let $R>0$ and $s>0$. Let $F(\lambda_1,\ldots,\lambda_N)$ be a bounded Borel function on $\mathbb R^2$ with ${\rm supp}\, F\subset \{\xi\in \mathbb{R}^2: \f{R^2}{4}\leq |\xi|\leq R^2\}$. Then for any $\epsilon>0$, there exists a constant $C=C(s,\epsilon)>0$ so that \begin{equation} \Big(\int_X |K_{F(L_1, \ldots,L_N)}(x, y)|^2(1+R|x-y|)^{2s} \Big)^{1/2}\leq \f{C}{V(y, R^{-1})^{1/2}}\|\delta_{R^2}F\|_{W^{\tilde q}_{s+\epsilon}(\mathbb{R}^n)} \end{equation} for all $y\in X$.
Assume that the condition \eqref{eq1-mainthmsm-multi} holds true. Then for any $x,y\in X$, \begin{equation}  |K_{F(L_1,\ldots,L_N)}(x, y)|\leq \f{C}{\sqrt{V(x,R^{-1})V(y,R^{-1})}}\|\delta_{R^2} F\|_{\tilde q} \end{equation} for all bounded Borel function $F$ with ${\rm supp}\, \subset [R^2/4,R^2]^N$.
Assume that the condition \eqref{eq1-mainthmsm-multi} holds true. Let $R,s>0$. Then for any $\epsilon>0$ there exists a constant $C=C(s,\epsilon)$ such that \begin{equation} |K_{F(L_1,\ldots,L_N)}(x,y)| \leq C\f{(1+Rd(x,y))^{-s}}{\sqrt{V(x,R^{-1})V(y,R^{-1})}}\|\delta_{R^2}F\|_{W^{\tilde q}_{s+\epsilon}} \end{equation} for any bounded Borel function $F$ supported in $[R^2/4, R^2]^N$ and for all $x,y\in X$.
Assume that $\alpha_k\geq 1$ for all $k=1,\ldots,n$. Let $\si(\lambda_1,\ldots,\lambda_n)=\eta(\lambda_1^2,\ldots,\lambda_n^2)$ with ${\rm supp}\, \eta\subset \{\xi\in \mathbb{R}^n: \f{R}{4}\leq|\xi|\leq R\}$ for some $R>0$. Then \begin{equation} \Big(\int_X |T_\si(x, y)|^2 \dx\Big)^{1/2}\leq \f{C}{V(y, 1/\sqrt{R})^{1/2}}\|\eta\|_{L^2(\mathbb{R}^n)}. \end{equation}
Let $s>\f{n}{2}$. Then for any bounded Borel function $F$ such that $\sup_{t>0}\|\eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\vc}_s}<\vc$ where $\delta_tF(\cdot)= F(t\cdot)$ and $\eta$ is a $C^\vc_c(\mathbb R_+)$ function, not identically zero, we have: \begin{enumerate}[\rm (a)] \item the spectral multiplier $F(\sqrt L)$ is bounded on $\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ provided that $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p,q <\vc$ and $s>n(\f{1}{1\wedge p\wedge q}-\f{1}{2})$, i.e., \[ \|F(\sqrt L)\|_{\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)\to \F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)}\lesi F(0)+\sup_{t>0}\|\eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\vc}_s}. \] \item the spectral multiplier $F(\sqrt L)$ is bounded on $\B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ provided that $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p<\vc$, $0<q\le \vc$ and $s>n(\f{1}{1\wedge p\wedge q}-\f{1}{2})$, i.e., $$ \|F(\sqrt L)\|_{\B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)\to \B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)}\lesi F(0) +\sup_{t>0}\|\eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\vc}_s}. $$ \end{enumerate}
Let $s>\f{n}{2}$ and let $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$ and $0<p,q<\vc$. Assume that for any $R>0$ and all Borel functions $F$ such that\, {\rm supp}\, $F\subseteq [0, R]$, the following holds for some $\tilde q\in [2, \infty]$: \begin{equation} \int_X |K_{F(\sqrt{L})}(x,y)|^2 d\mu(x) \leq \f{C}{V(y, R^{-1})} \|\delta_R F\|^2_{\tilde q}. \end{equation}  Assume that $F$ is a bounded Borel function satisfying the following condition \begin{equation}  \sup_{t>0}\|\eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_s}<\infty \end{equation} where $\delta_tF(\cdot)= F(t\cdot)$ and $\eta$ is a $C^\vc_c(\mathbb R_+)$ function, not identically zero.  Then we have: \begin{enumerate}[\rm (a)] \item the spectral multiplier $F(\sqrt L)$ is bounded on $\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ provided that $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p,q <\vc$ and $s>\max\left\{n(\f{1}{1\wedge p\wedge q}-\f{1}{2}), \f{1}{\tilde q}\right\}$, i.e., \[ \|F(\sqrt L)\|_{\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)\to \F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)}\lesi F(0)+\sup_{t>0}\|\eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_s}. \] \item the spectral multiplier $F(\sqrt L)$ is bounded on $\B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ provided that $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p<\vc$, $0<q\le \vc$ and $s>\max\left\{n(\f{1}{1\wedge p\wedge q}-\f{1}{2}),\f{1}{\tilde q}\right\}$, i.e., $$ \|F(\sqrt L)\|_{\B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)\to \B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)}\lesi F(0) +\sup_{t>0}\|\eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_s}. $$ \end{enumerate}
Let $\psi, \varphi\in C^\vc_c(\mathbb{R})$ be partitions of unity. Then we have: \begin{enumerate}[(a)] \item The spaces $\B^{\alpha, \psi, L}_{p,q}(X)$ and $\B^{\alpha, \varphi, L}_{p,q}(X)$ coincide with equivalent norms for all $0< p, q\le \vc$ and $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$.  \item The spaces $\F^{\alpha, \psi, L}_{p,q}(X)$ and $\F^{\alpha, \varphi, L}_{p,q}(X)$ coincide with equivalent norms for all $0< p< \vc$, $0<q\le \vc$ and $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$. \end{enumerate} For this reason, we define the spaces $\B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ and $\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ to be any spaces $\B^{\alpha, \psi, L}_{p,q}(X)$ and $\B^{\alpha, \psi, L}_{p,q,w}(X)$ with any partitions of unity $\psi$, respectively.
Let $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$ and $0<p,q\leq \vc$. For $M\in \mathbb{N}_+$, if $f\in \B^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}(X)$ then there exist a sequence of $(L,M,p)$ atoms $\{a_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu, \nu\in \mathbb{Z}}$ and a sequence of coefficients $\{s_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu, \nu\in\mathbb{Z}}$ so that $$ f=\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}s_Qa_Q \ \ \text{in $\mathcal{S}'_\vc$}. $$ Moreover, $$ \Big[\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}2^{\nu \alpha q}\Big(\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}|s_Q|^p\Big)^{q/p}\Big]^{1/q}\sim \|f\|_{\B^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}(X)}. $$
Let $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$ and $0<p,q\leq \vc$. If $$ f=\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}s_Qa_Q \ \ \text{in $\mathcal{S}'_\vc$} $$ where $\{a_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu, \nu\in \mathbb{Z}}$ is a sequence of $(L,M,p)$ atoms and $\{s_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu, \nu\in\mathbb{Z}}$ is a sequence of coefficients satisfying $$ \Big[\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}2^{\nu\alpha q}\Big(\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}|s_Q|^p\Big)^{q/p}\Big]^{1/q}<\vc, $$ then $f\in \B^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}(X)$ and $$ \|f\|_{\B^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}(X)} \lesi \Big[\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}\Big(\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}|s_Q|^p\Big)^{q/p}\Big]^{1/q} $$ as long as $M>\f{n}{2}+\f{1}{2}\max\{\alpha,\f{n}{1\wedge p\wedge q}-\alpha\}$.
Let $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p<\vc$ and $0<q\leq \vc$. If $f\in \F^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}(X)$ then there exist a sequence of $(L,M,p)$ atoms $\{a_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu, \nu\in \mathbb{Z}}$ and a sequence of coefficients $\{s_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu, \nu\in\mathbb{Z}}$ so that $$ f=\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}s_Qa_Q \ \ \text{in $\mathcal{S}'_\vc$}. $$ Moreover, \begin{equation} \Big\|\Big[\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}2^{\nu\alpha q}\Big(\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}V(Q)^{-1/p}|s_Q|\chi_Q\Big)^q\Big]^{1/q}\Big\|_{p}\lesi \|f\|_{\F^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}}. \end{equation}
Let $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p<\vc$ and $0<q\le \vc$. If $$ f=\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}s_Qa_Q \ \ \text{in $\mathcal{S}'_\vc$} $$ where $\{a_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu, \nu\in \mathbb{Z}}$ is a sequence of $(L,M,p)$ atoms and $\{s_Q\}_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu, \nu\in\mathbb{Z}}$ is a sequence of coefficients satisfying $$ \Big\|\Big[\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}2^{\nu\alpha q}\Big(\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}V(Q)^{-1/p}|s_Q|\chi_Q\Big)^q\Big]^{1/q}\Big\|_{p}<\vc, $$ then $f\in \F^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}$ and $$ \|f\|_{\F^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}} \lesi \Big\|\Big[\sum_{\nu\in\mathbb{Z}}2^{\nu\alpha q}\Big(\sum_{Q\in \mathscr{D}_\nu}V(Q)^{-1/p}|s_Q|\chi_Q\Big)^q\Big]^{1/q}\Big\|_{p,w} $$ provided $M>\f{n}{2}+\f{1}{2}\max\{\alpha,\f{n}{1\wedge p\wedge q}-\alpha\}$.
Let $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$ and $0<p\le 1< q<\vc$. If $f\in \F^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}(X)\cap L^2(X)$ then there exist a sequence of new $(L, M, \alpha, p, q)$ atoms $\{a_j\}_j$ and a sequence of coefficients $\{\lambda_j\}_j$ so that $$ f=\sum_j \lambda_ja_j \ \ \text{in $L^2(X)$}. $$ Moreover, \begin{equation} \Big(\sum_j |\lambda_j|^p\Big)^{1/p}\lesi \|f\|_{\F^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}}. \end{equation}  Conversely, if $f\in L^2(X)$ such that $$ f=\sum_j \lambda_ja_j \ \ \text{in $L^2(X)$} $$ where $\{a_j\}_j$ is a sequence of new $(L, M, \alpha, p, q)$ atoms with $M>\f{n}{2p}$ and $\{\lambda_j\}_j\in \ell^p$, then $f\in \F^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}(X)$ and \begin{equation} \|f\|_{\F^{\alpha,L}_{p,q}}\lesi \Big(\sum_j |\lambda_j|^p\Big)^{1/p}. \end{equation}
Let $\theta\in (0,1), s_1, s_2\in \mathbb{R}, s_1\neq s_2$ and $s=(1-\theta)s_1+\theta s_2$. \begin{enumerate}[{\rm (i)}] \item If $0< p, q_1, q_2, q\leq \vc$ then \begin{equation} \left(\B^{s_1,L}_{p,q_1}(X),\B^{s_2,L}_{p,q_2}(X)\right)_{\theta,q}=\B^{s,L}_{p,q}(X). \end{equation}  \item If $0<p, q_1, q_2, q< \vc$ then \begin{equation} \left(\F^{s_1,L}_{p,q_1}(X),\F^{s_2,L}_{p,q_2}(X)\right)_{\theta,q}=\B^{s,L}_{p,q}(X). \end{equation}  \end{enumerate}
Let $s>\f{n}{2}$ and let $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$ and $0<p,q<\vc$. Assume that the condition \eqref{eq1-mainthmsm} holds true. If $F$ is a bounded Borel function which satisfies the condition \eqref{smoothness condition}, then \begin{enumerate}[(a)] \item the spectral multiplier $F(\sqrt L)$ is bounded on $\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,2}(X)$ provided that $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p<\vc$ and $s>n(\f{1}{p\wedge 1}-\f{1}{2})$; moreover, \begin{equation} \|F(\sqrt L)\|_{\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,2}(X)\to \F^{\alpha, L}_{p,2}(X)}\lesi \|F\|_{L^\vc} +\sup_{t>0}\|\eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_s}. \end{equation} \item the spectral multiplier $F(\sqrt L)$ is bounded on $\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ provided that $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p,q< \vc$ and $s>\f{n}{1\wedge p\wedge q}+\f{\tilde{n}}{2}$; moreover, \begin{equation} \|F(\sqrt L)\|_{\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)\to \F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)}\lesi \|F\|_{L^\vc}+ \sup_{t>0}\|\eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_s}. \end{equation} \end{enumerate}
Let $s>0$ and let $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$ and $0<p,q<\vc$. Assume that for any $R>0$ and all Borel functions $F$ with {\rm supp}\, $F\subseteq [R^2/4, R^2]^N$, the following holds for some $\tilde q\in [2, \infty]$: \begin{equation} \int_X |K_{F(L_1, \ldots,L_N)}(x,y)|^2 d\mu(x) \leq \f{C}{V(y, R^{-1})} \|\delta_{R^2} F\|^2_{\tilde q}. \end{equation}  Assume that $F$ is a bounded Borel function satisfying the following condition \begin{equation}  \sup_{t>0}\|\tilde \eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_s}<\infty \end{equation} where $\tilde \eta(\lambda_1,\ldots,\lambda_N)=\eta(\lambda_1+\lambda_2)$ with $\eta\in C^\vc_c(\mathbb R_+)$. Then we have: \begin{enumerate}[(a)] \item the multivariate spectral multiplier $F(L_1, \ldots,L_N)$ is bounded on $\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ provided that $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p,q <\vc$ and $s>\f{n}{2}(\f{1}{1\wedge p\wedge q}-\f{1}{2})$ where $n=n_1+\ldots+n_N$, i.e., \[ \|F(L_1, \ldots,L_N)\|_{\F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)\to \F^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)}\lesi \sup_{t>0}\|\tilde \eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_s}. \] \item the multivariate spectral multiplier $F(L_1, \ldots,L_N)$ is bounded on $\B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)$ provided that $\alpha\in \mathbb{R}$, $0<p<\vc$, $0<q\le \vc$ and $s>\f{n}{2}(\f{1}{1\wedge p\wedge q}-\f{1}{2})$, i.e., $$ \|F(L_1, \ldots,L_N)\|_{\B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)\to \B^{\alpha, L}_{p,q}(X)}\lesi \sup_{t>0}\|\tilde \eta\, \delta_tF\|_{W^{\tilde q}_s}. $$ \end{enumerate}
Let $\alpha_k\geq 1$ for all $k=1,\ldots,n$ and $\f{Q}{Q+1}<p\leq 1$. Assume that $\si(\lambda_1,\ldots,\lambda_n)=\eta(\lambda^2_1,\ldots,\lambda^2_n)$ where $\eta$ is a function on $L^\vc(\mathbb{R}^n)$ satisfying the condition \begin{equation} \sup_{j\in \mathbb{Z}}\|\psi(\cdot)\delta_{2^j}\eta(\cdot)\|_{W^2_s(\mathbb{R}^n)}<\vc \end{equation} for some $s>Q(\f{1}{p}-\f{1}{2})$, where $\delta_t\eta(\cdot)=\eta(t\cdot)$, $\psi$ is a function in $C^\vc(\mathbb{R}^n)$ with ${\rm supp}\, \psi\subset \{\xi\in \mathbb{R}^n: 1/2\leq |\xi|\leq 2\}$. Then $T_\sigma$ is bounded on the Hardy spaces $H^p_{CW}(X)$ in the sense of Coifmann and Weiss.
Let $\alpha_k> -1$ for all $k=1,\ldots,n$ and $\f{Q}{Q+1}<p\leq 1$. Assume that $\si(\lambda_1,\ldots,\lambda_n)=\eta(\lambda^2_1,\ldots,\lambda^2_n)$ where $\eta$ is a function on $L^\vc(\mathbb{R}^n)$ satisfying the condition \begin{equation} \sup_{j\in \mathbb{Z}}\|\psi(\cdot)\delta_{2^j}\eta(\cdot)\|_{W^\vc_s(\mathbb{R}^n)}<\vc \end{equation} for some $s>Q(\f{1}{p}-\f{1}{2})$, where $\delta_t\eta(\cdot)=\eta(t\cdot)$, $\psi$ is a function in $C^\vc(\mathbb{R}^n)$ with ${\rm supp}\, \psi\subset \{\xi\in \mathbb{R}^n: 1/2\leq |\xi|\leq 2\}$. Then $T_\sigma$ is bounded on the Hardy spaces $H^p_{CW}(X)$ in the sense of Coifmann and Weiss.
Let $v$ be a vertex in $P_{k+1,n+1}$. \begin{enumerate} \item Define $u$ by $v=u-1 \pmod n$. There are three cases depending on the position of the letter $n$ in $v$: \begin{enumerate} \item if $v_1=n$, then $\Des(u)=\Des(v)\backslash\{1\}$, thus $u\in P_{k,n+1}$; \item if $v_n=n$, then $\Des(u)=\Des(v)\cup\{n-1\}$ and $u\in P_{k+2,n+1}$; \item if $v_i=n$ with $i\neq 1,n$, then $\Des(u)=\Des(v)\cup\{i-1\}\backslash\{i\}$ and $u\in P_{k+1,n+1}$. \end{enumerate}  \item Let $e_i=(u,v)$ be a type one edge in $P$. Then we have $\Des(u)=\Des(v)$. In this case, we also compare $\LdDes(u)$ and $\LdDes(v)$: \begin{enumerate} \item if $i,i+1\in \LdDes(u)$ or $i,i+1\notin \LdDes(u)$, we have $\LdDes(u)=\LdDes(v)$; \item otherwise, if $i\in \LdDes(u)$ and $i+1\notin \LdDes(u)$, we have $\LdDes(v)=\LdDes(u)\cup\{i+1\}\backslash\{i\}$. \end{enumerate} \end{enumerate}
Let $v$ be a vertex in $Q$. Then \begin{enumerate} \item $v$ has an incoming type one edge ($e_i$ with $i\neq 0$) if and only if one of the following two holds: \begin{enumerate} \item $i\in B_v$; \item $i\in C_v\cap\Des(v)$. \end{enumerate} \item $v$ has an incoming type two edge ($e_0$) if and only if $v_n\neq n$. \end{enumerate}
Let $e_i=(u,v)\in Q$ and $i\in C_u$. Then $$u=\begin{cases} s_i(v), & \CT(u)\neq \CT(v)\\ t_is_i(v), & \CT(u)= \CT(v) \end{cases}, $$ where $\CT(w)$ stands for the cycle type of $w$ defined in Section 1.3.
Let $u\leftarrow\cdots\leftarrow v$ be a sequence of edges in a small block of $Q$ with edge set $E$. Then $i_E(v)<i_E(u)$.
Let $I\subset\{1,2,\dots,n-1\}$. For a permutation $w\in\mathfrak{S}_n$, consider the set $E(w)$ of all the permutations obtained by applying any sequence of $t_i$, $(i\in I)$ to $w$, i.e., $$E(w)=\{u=t_{i_1}\dots t_{i_k}(w)\mid i_j\in I \text{ for some }k\}.$$ Then there exists a unique $u\in E(w)$ such that $F^{-1}(u)$ has ascents in $I$.

(see \cite{KST}, p. 43). For any $t\geq 0$ one has \begin{equation*} E_{\rho, \mu}(t) =\frac{1}{\rho}t^{\frac{1}{\rho}(1-\mu)} e^{t^{\frac{1}{\rho}}} +O(t^{-1}). \end{equation*}

(see \cite{KST}, p. 98) The Laplace transform of the Caputo derivative of a function $f\in C^1(\mathbb{R}_+)$, is \[ L[D_t^{\beta} f](s)= s^{\beta}L[{f}](s) - f(0) s^{\beta-1},\,\,\, s>0. \]
Let the vector-functions $Y(t,x), \, Z(t,x) \in {\mathbf C} ([0,T]; {\mathbf L_2}(\mathbb{R}^n))$. Then for any $\eta_1, \, \eta_2 \in [0,T]$ the estimate \[ \bigg|\bigg|\int\limits_{\eta_1}^{\eta_2} S'(\eta_2-\eta, D) \big[H(\eta,x, Y)-H(\eta,x, Z)\big] d\eta\bigg|\bigg|_{{\mathbf L}_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}\leq \] \begin{equation} c_1 (\eta_2-\eta_1)^\beta \sum\limits_{k=1}^m \max_{t\in [0,T]} ||y_k(t,\cdot)-z_k(t,\cdot)||_{L_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}, \end{equation} is valid. Where the constant $c_1$ depends only on numbers ${L,\beta, T, R_0}$.
Let a vector-functions $Y(t,x) \in {\mathbf C} ([0,T]; {\mathbf L_2}(\mathbb{R}^n))$. Then the estimate \begin{equation} \bigg|\bigg|\int\limits_{0}^{t} S'(t-\eta, D) H(\eta,x, Y) d\eta\bigg|\bigg|_{{\mathbf L}_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}\leq c_2 \sum\limits_{k=1}^m \max_{t\in [0,T]}\left( ||y_k(t,\cdot)||_{L_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}+||h_k(t,\cdot, 0)||_{L_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}\right), \end{equation} is valid. Where the constant $c_2$ depends only on numbers ${L,\beta, T, R_0}$.

Let $0<\rho<1$. Let a vector-functions $Y(t,x) \in {\mathbf C} ([0,T]; {\mathbf L_2}(\mathbb{R}^n))$. Then for any $\eta_1, \, \eta_2 \in [0,T]$ the estimate \begin{equation} \bigg|\bigg|\int\limits_{\eta_1}^{\eta_2} S'(\eta_2-\eta, D) H(\eta,x, Y) d\eta\bigg|\bigg|_{L_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}\leq c_2 (\eta_2-\eta_1)^\beta \sum\limits_{k=1}^m \max_{t\in [0,T]}\left( ||y_k(t,\cdot)||_{L_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}+||h_k(t,\cdot, 0)||_{L_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}\right), \end{equation} is valid. (see M.A. Krasnoselski et al. \cite{Krasnos}, p. 453). Let $A(D)$ be an elliptic operator of order $l$, $\alpha$ be a multi-index, $|\alpha|\leq l$ and $\nu > \frac{|\alpha|}{l}+\frac{n}{2l}$. Then the operator $D^\alpha (\hat{A}+I)^{-\nu}$ continuously maps from $L_2(\mathbb{R}^n)$ into $C(\mathbb{R}^n)$ and the following estimate holds true \begin{equation} ||D^\alpha (\hat{A}+I)^{-\nu} f||_{C(\mathbb{R}^n)} \leq C ||f||_{L_2(\mathbb{R}^n)}. \end{equation}
(The Gershgorin circle theorem). The eigenvalues of the Hermitian matrix $A$ are in the union of the Gershgorin segments \[ G(A)=\bigcup\limits_{j=1}^m \{t\in \mathbb{R}: \,\, |t-a_{j,j}|\leq \varepsilon_j(A)\} \] Furthermore, if the union of $k$ of the $m$ segments that comprise $G(A)$ forms a set $G_k(A)$ that is disjoint from the remaining $m - k$ segmants, then $G_k(A)$ contains exactly $ k$ eigenvalues of $A$, counted according to their algebraic multiplicities.
Let matrix $\mathcal{A}(\xi)$ satisfy Conditions (A). Let initial and source functions satisfy conditions \begin{equation} \varPhi(x) \in {\mathbf L}^{\tau+\tau^*}_2(\mathbb{R}^n),\quad H(t,x) \in {\mathbf C} ([0,T]; {\mathbf L_2}^{\tau+\tau^*}(\mathbb{R}^n)) \quad \tau > \frac{n}{2}. \end{equation} Then the Linear Problem has a unique solution $U(t,x)=\langle{u_1(t,x), u_2(t,x), \dots, u_m(t,x)}\rangle$ having the representation \begin{equation}  U(t,x) = S(t,D)\varPhi(x)+\int\limits_0^t S'(\eta, D) H(t-\eta,x) d\eta, \quad 0\leq t\leq T, \ x\in \re^n, \end{equation} where $S(t,D)$ and $S'(\eta, D)$ are the pseudo-differential operators defined above. Moreover, each $u_j$ has the property \begin{equation} \lim\limits_{|x|\rightarrow\infty} D^\alpha u_j(t, x)=0,\quad |\alpha|\leq \ell_{j,j}, \quad t>0, \end{equation} and for $t>0$ obeys the coercive type estimate \begin{align} ||D^\beta_t u_{j}(t,x)||_{C(\mathbb{R}^n)}&+\sum\limits_{k=1}^m||A_{j,k}(D) u_{k}(t,x)||_{C(\mathbb{R}^n)}\notag \\ &\leq C \sum\limits_{k=1}^m \left(t^{-\beta}||\varphi_k||_{L_2^{{\tau+\tau^*}}(\mathbb{R}^n)}+\max_{t\in [0,T]}||h_k(t, \cdot)||_{L_2^{{\tau+\tau^*}}(\mathbb{R}^n)}\right). \end{align}
Let matrix $\mathcal{A}(\xi)$ satisfy Conditions (A). Let the initial functions satisfy the condition $ \varPhi(x) \in {\mathbf L}^{\tau+\tau^*}_2(\mathbb{R}^n), \, \tau > \frac{n}{2},$ and $H(t,x, U)$ satisfy conditions (\ref{H_L}) and (\ref{H0}). Then the Nonlinear Problem has a unique solution $U(t,x)=\langle{u_1(t,x), u_2(t,x), \dots, u_m(t,x)}\rangle$, and each $u_j$ has the property \[ \lim\limits_{|x|\rightarrow\infty} D^\alpha u_j(t, x)=0,\quad |\alpha|\leq \ell_{j,j}, \quad t>0. \] Moreover, if $U^1=\langle{u_1^1, \cdots, u_m^1\rangle}$ and $U^2=\langle{u_1^2, \cdots, u_m^2\rangle}$ are two solutions to the Nonlinear Problem corresponding to two initial functions $\varPhi^1=\langle{\varphi_1^1, \cdots, \varphi_m^1\rangle}$ and $\varPhi^2=\langle{\varphi_1^2, \cdots, \varphi_m^2\rangle}$, respectively, then the stability estimate \begin{equation} \max_{t\in [0,T]}||u^1_{j}(t,x)-u_j^2 (t,x)||_{C(\mathbb{R}^n)}\leq C \sum\limits_{k=1}^m ||\varphi^1_k-\varphi_k^2||_{L_2^{{\tau+\tau^*}}(\mathbb{R}^n)},\,\, j=1, \cdots, m, \end{equation} is valid.
Let $A_1,\dots,A_n$ be subsets of an abelian group. Then $$ \left(\E^{+} \left(\bigcup_{i=1}^n A_i\right)\right)^{1/4} \le \sum_{i=1}^n (\E^{+} (A_i))^{1/4}. $$
Let $A\subseteq \F_p$ with $|A|>p^{1/2}$. Then $$ \sum_{x\in \F_p^*} \E^+(A,xA), \; \sum_{x\in \F_p^*} \E^\times(A,x+A) \ll |A|^4. $$
Let $A\subseteq \mathbb{F}_p,$ $X\subseteq \mathbb{F}_p^*$. Suppose $|X|=O(|A|^2)$ and $|A|^2|X|=O(p^2)$. Then $$\sum_{x\in X}\E^+(A,xA) \ll \E^+(A)^{1/2} |A|^{3/2}|X|^{3/4}$$ and $$\sum_{x\in X}\E^\times(A,x+A) \ll \E^\times(A)^{1/2}|A|^{3/2}|X|^{3/4} \,.$$
For every set $X \subseteq \F_p^*$ we have the following inequality $$ \sum_{x\in X} \left(\E^+(A, xA) -\frac{ |A|^4}{p}\right),\, \sum_{x\in X} \left(\E^\times(A, x+A) -\frac{ |A|^4}{p}\right) \; \leq \; p|A|^2\,.$$
Let $A\subseteq \mathbb{F}_{p}$, $|A|> p^{1/2}$ and $1\leq K\leq p\frac{\E^+(A)}{2|A|^{4}}$. \\ Then the number of $x\in \mathbb{F}_p^*$ such that $\E^+(A,xA)>\frac{\E^+(A)}{K}$ is $O\left(K^{4}\frac{|A|^{6}}{\E^+(A)^{2}}\right)$.  A similar bound holds for the number of $x\in \mathbb{F}_p^*$ such that $\E^+(A,x+A)>\frac{\E^\times(A)}{K}$.
Let $A\subset \mathbb R$ be a set and $\d = 2/33$. Then there are two disjoint subsets $B$ and $C$ of $A$ such that $A = B\sqcup C$ and $$ \max\{ \E^{+} (B), \E^{\times} (C)\} \lesssim |A|^{3-\delta}. $$
The number of incidences between a set of $m$ lines and $n$ points in $\mathbb C^2$ is $O[(mn)^{2/3} + m + n]$.
The number of incidences between a set of $m$ planes and $n\leq m$ points in $\F^3$ is $O[m (n^{1/2} +k )]$, where $k$ is the maximum number of collinear points, under an additional constraint $n\leq p^2$ in positive characteristic.
Consider a set of $m$ lines in $\F^2$.  (i) Let $A\times B\subset \F^2$ be a set of $n$ points, with $n^{1/2}<m<n^{3/2}$ and the constraint $mn^2<p^4$ in positive characteristic. The number of incidences between the above sets of points and lines is $O(m^{3/4}n^{5/8}).$  (ii) For any set of $n$ points in $\F^2$, with $n^{7/8}<m<n^{8/7}$ and $m^{13}n^{-2} < p^{15}$, the number of incidences with the set of $m$ lines is $O[(mn)^{11/15}].$
Let $A\subset \F$.There exists $A'\subseteq A$, such that $|A'|\geq |A|/2$, and \begin{equation*} \min [ \E^+(A'),\,\E^\times(A') ] \lesssim |A|^{3-\delta}, \end{equation*} where $\delta=1/4$ in the special case $\F=\mathbb C$ and $\delta = 1/5$ for any $\F$, with an additional constraint $|A|\leq p^{5/8}$ in positive characteristic.
Let $A\subseteq \F_p, $ with $|A| \gg p^{25/42}\log^K |A|$, for some absolute constant $K$. Let $A\subset \mathbb C$ be a set, $\a \neq 0$, and $\d = 1/4$.
